### Milestone

<p>
  <a href="https://github.com/The-FireHub-Project/Core-Foundation/milestone/1/">
    <img
      src="https://img.shields.io/github/milestones/progress-percent/The-FireHub-Project/Core-Foundation/1?style=flat&logo=github&logoColor=959da5&labelColor=31373e"
      alt="GitHub milestone details"
  /></a>
</p>

This branch contains the initial development of foundational internal utilities for **FireHub Core Foundation v0.2.0**.  
The purpose of this PR is to establish a stable, consistent, and runtime-ready **Autoloader** and **Bootstrap system** for all low-level classes and future modules.

## Purpose

The `feature/bootstrap-autoload` branch focuses on establishing the **initial Core Foundation bootstrap** by:

- Providing a central `FireHub` bootstrap class for external configuration injection
- Introducing the **autoload mechanism** for all FireHub Core classes
- Standardizing internal class loading for future modules, adapters, and extensions
- Laying the foundation for consistent initialization across all Core variants (Foundation, Professional, Enterprise)

This branch represents a key step toward the **first stable Core Foundation release (v0.2.0)**.

## Scope

This branch includes:

- The `FireHub` bootstrap class with external configuration support
- `SplAutoload` wrapper class to handle autoloading of Core classes
- Internal kernel initialization (`CoreKernel`) for framework runtime
- Namespaced, final, low-level helper classes designed for **performance, safety, and predictability**

Out of scope for this branch:

- Public-facing APIs beyond Core Foundation
- Domain-specific abstractions or use-cases
- Adapters or module-specific code
- Tooling, CI/CD pipelines, PHAR packaging

## Stability & Compatibility

- Changes are internal and backward compatible
- No public contracts are introduced or modified
- Safe for reuse across all Core distributions

## Workflow

- Development happens exclusively on this feature branch
- All work is tracked via a single feature issue
- The branch will be merged into `develop` once the scope is complete
- The merge marks the completion of the `v0.2.0` milestone


## Related

- Milestone: **Development v1**
- Target Release: **v0.2.0**
- Repository: FireHub Core Foundation
